sen.j: 蚊屋木間（かや の このま、生年不明 - 持統天皇7年（693年）8月16日?）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: KAYA no Konoma (蚊屋木間, date of birth unknown - August 16, 693?) is a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.
KAYA no Konoma (date of birth unknown - August 16, 693?) lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
KAYA no Konoma (date of birth unknown - August 16, 693?) lived in the Asuka period of Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.
The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.
The reading is the same in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His kabane (hereditary title) is Imiki.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Imiki.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Imiki.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側についた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).

Jikikosan (the fourteenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Shogoinoge, Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), posthumously conferred
He was given posthumously the rank of Jikikosan.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一します。他の記事で原文の文章の「位」の上に制度の説明がついているものがありました。その場合はその説明の訳が必要だと思いますが、この記事のように何も加えられていない場合、特別な説明は不要だと思われます。
sen.e: He was given posthumously the rank of Jikikosan.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の贈位記事においてのみ現れる。
sen.e: He is mentioned only in the article on conferral of a posthumous rank in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He is mentioned only in the article on the posthumous conferral to him in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 持統天皇7年（693年）9月16日に、天皇は直広参と賻物（葬儀の際の贈り物）を蚊屋忌寸木間に贈った。
sen.e: On August 16, 693, the Emperor gave KAYA no Imiki Konoma Jikikosan and Hakubutsu (gifts given at a funeral ceremony).
On September 16, 693, Empress Jito gave KAYA no Imiki Konoma the rank of Jikikosan and haburimono (gift given at funeral).
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。「賻物」は「はぶりもの」。原文に「8月」とありましたが「9月」の間違いなので直します。（『日本書紀』本文を確認しました。）
sen.e: On September 16, 693, Empress Jito gave KAYA no Imiki Konoma the rank of Jikikosan and haburimono (gift given at funeral).

sen.j: 壬申の年の功を褒めたためという。
sen.e: This was to admire his service in the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac).
Those were rewards for his service in the year of Jinshin (the Jinshin War).

sen.j: この日かその直前に死んだと思われる。
sen.e: It is presumable that he died on or just prior to that day.
